newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares fall as foreigners pull the plug.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares fall as foreigners pull the plug.

text.p: Slovenian shares fell two percent on Tuesday, widening recent losses which traders blamed on the exit of many foreign investors from the country's fledgling equity market.
"This market has become dependent on foreign investors, whose future steps are hard to predict, so it is hard to say what will happen next," said Karmen Cerar, a trader at brokerage Poteza.
* The SBI index fell 24.96 points to 1,224.8.
* Overall 12 shares fell, six rose, three were unchanged and three untraded.
* Turnover fell to 304.4 million tolars from 399.3 million. -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
